intro: Beloperone nuda, commonly known as the naked beloperone, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Beloperone nuda is considered a vulnerable species.
